description: Borrowed from late Middle French tacite, or from Latin tacitus (“that is passed over in silence, done without words, assumed as a matter of course, silent”), from tacere (“to be silent”).

adjectives.description: tacit (comparative more tacit, superlative most tacit)

entries.meaning: Implied, but not made explicit, especially through silence.
examples: tacit consent : consent by silence, or by not raising an objection

entries.meaning: (logic) Not derived from formal principles of reasoning; based on induction rather than deduction.
